{
  "cells": [
    {
      "cell_type": "markdown",
      "metadata": {},
      "source": [
        "# Data Analysis Example\n",
        "\n",
        "A simple demonstration of pandas and data visualization."
      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "execution_count": null,
      "metadata": {},
      "outputs": [],
      "source": [
        "import pandas as pd\n",
        "import numpy as np\n",
        "\n",
        "# Create sample data\n",
        "np.random.seed(42)\n",
        "data = {\n",
        "    'date': pd.date_range('2024-01-01', periods=100),\n",
        "    'sales': np.random.randint(100, 1000, 100),\n",
        "    'category': np.random.choice(['A', 'B', 'C'], 100)\n",
        "}\n",
        "df = pd.DataFrame(data)\n",
        "df.head()"
      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "markdown",
      "metadata": {},
      "source": [
        "## Summary Statistics"
      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "execution_count": null,
      "metadata": {},
      "outputs": [],
      "source": [
        "# Group by category\n",
        "summary = df.groupby('category')['sales'].agg([\n",
        "    'count', 'mean', 'std', 'min', 'max'\n",
        "]).round(2)\n",
        "\n",
        "print(\"Sales by Category\")\n",
        "summary"
      ]
    },
    {
      "cell_type": "code",
      "execution_count": null,
      "metadata": {},
      "outputs": [],
      "source": [
        "# Monthly trend\n",
        "monthly = df.set_index('date').resample('W')['sales'].sum()\n",
        "monthly.plot(kind='line', figsize=(10, 4), title='Weekly Sales')\n",
        "plt.ylabel('Sales')\n",
        "plt.show()"
      ]
    }
  ],
  "metadata": {
    "kernelspec": {
      "display_name": "Python 3",
      "language": "python",
      "name": "python3"
    },
    "language_info": {
      "name": "python",
      "version": "3.11.0"
    }
  },
  "nbformat": 4,
  "nbformat_minor": 4
}
